main event: A bright comet-like object was sighted by military and civilian observers over the Southern Hemisphere, tracked for 2-3 minutes.
interesting points: The object had a long tail of bright light and appeared to be stationary or moving slowly at a very high altitude.
Observers reported the object was visible for 2-3 minutes before disappearing.
The object was tracked from multiple locations, with observers providing detailed information on its position, direction of travel, and elevation above the horizon.
Observers were unsure if the object was a satellite, missile, or some other type of unknown aerial phenomenon.
The sighting was reported through military channels and formally documented as a CIRVIS (Celestial Illumination Reporting and Vital Intelligence Sighting) report.
sighted object: a bright comet-like object with a long tail of light
